2oXjv5EzSw2AIGlAgEAnrw.text: Strip mall atmosphere. Ambivalent server. Imbalanced drinks. Rotten oyster. Underwhelming salad. Oddly fizzy gazpacho. Undercooked fish. Poor presentation. Salt drenched steak.             Stay away.

16Py-2p-Bx9ZvncW53CJhw.text: Truly excellent. We had dinner on 3/9/19 and everything was on par with the best restaurants in Pittsburgh. The cocktails were solid, salads were great, and the entrees were fantastic. I had the sea bass Oscar style and it was one of the best seafood dishes I've had in a long time.  Definitely will return.

l3BZZXc6L1Tf2D6r8L9SHw.text: Cioppino is a really nice place in a up and coming area of P-burgh. Great high-end atmosphere without being stuffy. Best service I have experienced in P-burgh.

3TymggrEySxVCB4d3WQ4ag.text: Very comfortable place...food is reasonably priced for being upscale and the kicker, a whiskey and cigar bar! After dinner (happy hour in this case, which is great), going to have a nice cigar and. Bourbon! What a way to bring on the weekend!

photos.caption: Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

kisLnub-fgEWqThDlei9Hg.text: Food was excellent. The music choice inside was a little absurd however. From "Everybody Dance Now" to Taylor Swift and Counting Crows. Had a bad effect on the the atmosphere, but it was very tolerable considering the quality of the food and service. I had the NY strip steak which was perfectly cooked. The octopus I had for an appetizer was some of the best I've had in Pittsburgh. They also have a great beef tartare and oysters!

UDIPIMtO6xva3zdXKyCBGw.text: I came here for dinner on a Thursday night with a friend who so graciously used a gift card on me that I bought him. Talk about a pal.   The service was excellent as our waiter was very knowledgeable and checked on us multiple times. He was friendly and helpful!   I had the caesar salad with anchovies to start. For dinner I had the crab cakes with a side of bacon mac and cheese that came with it, it was not a side I purposely chose. I would not have put mac and cheese with crab cakes but would have preferred a veggie or a grain. The adjoining Osteria cigar and whiskey bar is always hopping and I think I would have preferred to eat over there! Overall a nice experience.

oKh95a8B44OoRZYw3vqfHg.text: Let me start off by saying that the best part of this place is the cigar bar. It's really really nice with a very warm atmosphere. You can bring your own cigars.   My cousin came into town and I wanted a place to meet to have a cigar followed by dinner. So I suggested this place and we met and had a cigar and cocktails. I had it in my head that we would leave after that and go to gauchos for dinner because I have eaten here before and was less than impressed. However my cousin said he had looked at the menu online and it looked good and was in the mood for steak. He also said he didn't feel like driving to go anywhere else.   So against my better judgment I acquiesced and we got a table in the dining room. It was a Thursday night in the dining room was virtually empty at 8 o'clock. That should've been a tip off.  For an appetizer we shared the calamari which was very good but they had some mayonnaise-based lemony dipping sauce and not the traditional marinara sauce on the side. The dipping sauce did nothing for the appetizer.  The presentation in both our meals was Unimpressive.  My cousin selected the steak and to be honest it look like it was cooked perfectly. He said he enjoyed it But I don't know if he was just being polite.  I selected the cioppino which should've been a signature dish. When it arrived there were half a dozen over cooked muscles a couple of clams and 2 x 3" piece of what I suspect was Tapiatila in an unflavorful broth. There was one large shrimp that was pretty good. But if this was the signature dish for the restaurant they failed miserably. Half The plate was taken up by pieces of toasted Italian bread. I didn't even want to dip in the broth. When I left I was still hungry and considered stopping at McDonald's but passed on that and headed home. Fortunately my wife had gone out and gotten some chicken wings and brought home the leftovers which I hungrily devoured.   Where it not for the cigar bar I would give this place one star.   I will say that the bar portion of the restaurant was pretty well attended and they had live music which we could hear in the dining room and wasn't overly loud.   So bottom line is if you want to go here for a cocktail or cigar it's pretty good but if you want to eat here forget it find someplace else !  There were too many good restaurants in the strip and this place failed miserably to meet the mark, especially for the prices that they were charging. I would not recommend it.

zotQ52fsaGQpXMxQ9KclBA.text: Cioppino is by far one of the best restaurants I have tried since coming to Pittsburgh. I would 100% recommend should you be even remotely within driving distance!   Our server for this Thursday evening was Bob and I can say without a doubt, working in the business, this man knew exactly what we needed at all times and presented it in a way that was accessible and friendly to us ragtag group of college students.  I had the Pork chop which, to say the least, was the equivalent of pure heaven melting in my mouth. While the beans were slightly cold, the Mac and cheese side addition more than made up for that.   Dessert was presented wonderfully, and the kitchen was kind enough to place the name of my friend who's birthday we were celebrating on the plate, something which is rarely done but made him feel very welcome even at the very end of the meal!  Overall, a wonderful dining experience with excellent selections and service that cannot be beat! Definitely give it a try!

PEQ6SMiY5Q8c2C_-pJNcrQ.text: Sat at the bar. Good service. Food was excellent. Had the sea bass.  Would do it again for sure.

GFtdr7_hzQdjaJOvq_kowA.text: Wednesday is 1/2 off local drafts, but 2 of the 4 local beers are kicked. So Yuengling or a Wheat from Pizza Boy. Neither is local to Pittsburgh. Yuengling is mass produced. Why bother?

bAmrzJNmSx5FUUAhiySahQ.text: Nice place to come relax after a long Friday at work you can have snackers apps or entrees delicious the filet mignon amazing this place is laid-back dark wood everywhere live jazz band and you can smoke cigars in the other part of the building O did I forget happy hour too   So check this place out my yelpers

Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chip and dip home made

EqwtyQLLKiW0TMh9jMbNRQ.text: First time visit with my wife and another couple.   Service was outstanding.  Complimentary Valet was easy to find and use.  Parking is tight in the strip.   My wife and I order steaks and they were cooked to perfection.   The appetizer of jumbo shrimp was very tasty.   The dessert sampler was very very very good.   I will definitely be back.

Z1w8xcysXSl3rZysyTWFZg.text: Cioppino is now one of my favorite places to grab a drink in Pittsburgh. Very relaxed atmosphere and Andy is one of the most knowledgeable bartenders that I have ever met. He creates top notch drinks and is very passionate about his craft.  The Fig Higgins with the fat washed Whistle Pig is by far my favorite drink on the menu.  The price may seem a little high for a cocktail, but it is definitely worth every penny! I would highly recommend making the trip to Cioppino to anyone, and make sure to grab a cocktail from Andy.

photos.caption: Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Boulevardier
Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fig Higgins.
Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I highly recommend the Fig Higgins!

3gKdmgUlyBLqr6WpnqXMgA.text: My absolute favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh. From the fresh baked bread to the delicious entrees, everything is pure perfection.

J6wg93n4mYiVySRqbvizxg.text: Loved everything from our service to our food! Definitely recommend this restaurant! The blues band that played that night was awesome too!

LIMuCoIBIvYyFqo2oPTngw.text: We got to Cioppino early on a Monday, there was almost no one there, so why our waitress was unseen for about 5 minutes I have no idea... We order drinks, and discuss the menu. It was restaurant week, so the SO decides to get that (salmon carpaccio, steak, cronut). I get the calamari and tuna. And we wait, and wait, and wait... FINALLY she comes back, annnnd brings our drinks. And we wait, and wait, and wait... She comes back, we order. 6 minutes later, we are wondering if we will get bread, since everyone else seems to have gotten bread when our apps arrive. Maybe we didn't order something that allows bread, whatever....  Calamari is.. disappointing, wayyyyy to greasy. Sitting in a pool of oil greasy Salmon is really salty, but way better than the calamari  Then we wait.....   Dinner comes at almost the exact same time as the bread we were wondering about earlier... I'm not sure what my SO thought of the steak, but he ate less than half of it. The tuna was not good. It was cooked rare, which I was warned about, but it was more like cooked all on one side medium and then just dropped on the other side for 2 seconds. On top of the inconsistent done-ness, it wasn't a great piece of fish.  Cronut was good.... but not good enough to make up for everything else. They said that the icecream had whiskey in it, but it tasted like plain vanilla to me.  Ohh I forgot to mention that the SO did the wine pairing. Wine was good, but the app pairing arrived 5 minutes before the app, dinner pairing arrived after we were more than half way done with dinner and he had to ask for it, and the dessert pairing arrived at the same time as our check, well after we were done eating the dessert.  What a mess.  Don't think I would waste $140 on the crappy service or crappy food again.

ofO-bbO7p2Eg4u10Ed1vcw.text: Went on a Saturday evening with the family. The drink specials and choices were excellent. They were different and were made perfect.   For appetizers we got the oysters, beef tartare, and calamari. All were excellent. Favorite was the calamari.   For the main meal I had the duck. It was perfect. Medium-rare. My brother had the new ribs off their smoker. Very good bark and taste. The scallops my sister had were cooked perfectly as well and were melt in your mouth.   The dessert was also amazing. I had a great time and want to come back to try more. My only negative might have been it took awhile but all in all great experience and evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The duck breast from Cioppino in Pittsburgh

rNHZmobXntkfKkk_78DumA.text: As a classy, elegant establishment, it was a perfect place to take my boyfriend for a date night, especially after all the fabulous reviews. There are plenty of meat and seafood entrees to satisfy his carnivorous appetite, and the restaurant offers alternative dishes off menu to accommodate vegetarians like myself. My boyfriend ordered the lamb while I decided to allow the chef to go rogue and whip me up surprise. The lamb came out slightly overcooked and was sent back. It took a while for the new dish to be prepared, but when it was, it was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing. Crispy on the outside, nice and juicy on the inside. He was very impressed (and that doesn't happen often!). My dish, however, was not as impressive. It was a vegetable medley that was greasy and over salted. Not your best work, chef. For dessert, we were offered a special ice cream cupcake which was DELICIOUS! It was a vanilla cake topped with a thick layer of birthday cake ice cream. So incredible. One of the best desserts I've had and trust me, I've had many.  One of my main concerns going into dinner was that the restaurant would reek of cigar smoke, but their ventilation system does a great job of removing the smell from the restaurant. Honestly, I would not have even known it was a cigar bar.   Our waitress was very charming and took great care of us throughout our dinner. We had several questions about the menu, and she was so helpful and patient. As the restaurant got busier, she became less attentive but it was understandable.   The parking was very convenient. I parked in the Cork Factory garage which was validated; however, complimentary valet is provided as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fries
Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Drinks &amp; Dessert Menu
Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lamb

cNvrZQ56SjPPYDSMyUHfbQ.text: This place is a nice hidden gem that sits right back off of the main drag of the strip district...well not really as a lot of people who live in the Cork Factory Lofts come here to enjoy a nice relaxing evening with live bands on the weekend and maybe a cigar or two. The dining area and bar area are separated by the main entrance with dim romantic lighting in both areas. The service is fantastic and the food is amazing, my fiance got the Filet and it was good to perfection and I got the salmon which was also amazing. The portions were just right and we were not overly full. After dinner we made our way over to the bar to relax and have a drink while they have a very good live band playing. After that we went into the cigar bar area that is behind the bar in an enclosed area with very good ventilation as you could not see any smoke when you went in other than that coming from the ends of cigars, cigarettes, or pipes. They have there own bar in there with high tops, low tops, and a couple couches making it the "ultimate man cave". You can purchase from a variety of cigars they have stocked or bring your own at no extra charge.   On a side note: They do have valet service as parking is very tight around the area there.  I definitely recommend going here at least once.

2_bhT-acp2SBpWI7juyQZg.text: Good relaxed vibe. Quality food prepared well by those who care. Oysters were fresh. Crab cakes were also good although slightly heavy due to frying - but crispy on the outside due to the same. I was happily surprised at the Mac N Cheese side for crab cake which felt like homemade goodness. Staff were super & polite & attentive. Overall, good place to have a good dinner with fam & friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oysters on the Half Shell* 1/2 Dozen
Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab Cake

X2klHFKdZLbqgQvFuHZ4Sw.text: My husband took me to Cioppino for an early birthday dinner and it was probably the best birthday dining experience I've ever had! I was surprised with Zuchinni blossoms also a birthday surprise treat and even a personalized "Happy Birthday Kristen" on both of our menus.  The food was phenomenal I had the sea scallops with lobster risotto and my husband the strip steak both portions were generous and perfectly cooked and presented.  Tom was our server and his service was top notch, he knows his stuff and was attentive with our timing since we had a show to attend that evening.  I highly recommend this restaurant and would return and recommend to friends and family.  My expectations are far exceeded and made for an amazing early birthday.  Thanks so much to Tom who made it enjoyable as well :)

rmmwZCj-cdkNwiliFOmJfA.text: Big Lights! Big City! Nature Boy! WOOOOO!   Aside from all that we braved the rain and headed further into the Strip District for a late dinner seating. Driving to the location (well in our case Uber) you kind of wonder where it is- then all of a sudden you're there.   They have some parking on the street and the option for valet. We were dropped off like some kids at the mall on a Friday night.   Upon entry the place is very upscale- dark wood, dim lights, a lot of attention to detail in every little thing. I would say it is an upscale restaurant so don't attempt to enter dressed like you rolled out of bed.   We were sat next to the window in the bar area- which wasn't a bad seat, however there were these really intimate style couches that I wish we could have tried.   We opted to order an appetizer of the carb dip which came with homemade saltines. Reminded me of the Cracker chips at the bottom of the bag that they threw on the plate. Dip was very good, garnished with some lemon juice - but the saltines may need upgraded at some point.   For the entree I fired on the cassoulet- which was first for me in trying something new. It is made with beans and as anyone who knows me knows- as long as they aren't pureed and refried I can deal. Different mouth feel- but this was very hearty and the sauce was incredible.   We passed on dessert- not really able to find anything that caught our attention.   I highly recommend it. Well done.

photos.caption: Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3JB1uZSniGx3vMXB_5ukEw.text: The food here was solid I had the Brussel sprouts and bacon,the Dry aged bone in ribeye, mac n cheese and cheese cake.   Atmosphere was very nice and typical of a white table cloth restaurant. No worry of smell the cigar bar it's separated.   Bone in Ribeye was delicious and dry aged,  lots of flavor and very tender and juicy.  Giving it a 9 out of 10.   Brussel sprouts and bacon were very good and I give those a 9 out of 10  Mac n cheese was good but past was a hair over cooked but still delicious I give it an 8 out of 10.   Cheesecake was small but had tons of flavor with a white chocolate shell and dark chocolate in the center surrounded by cheesecake. Give it a 9 out of 10.   I definitely recommend the place for a solid meal.

S9cQTgoLfCRkaTlNlSiB9A.text: Pretty on point here.  Made NYE reservations and just like we're taken there by Uber, seated, ate, and left.   It was so rainy.  This is a really cute place and we sat by the window to people watch.  The scallops were BANGING! Wish there were more.  No good dessert choice. Should've had a standard strawberry cheesecake option at this ritzy of a place.  Servers were professional and everything was served traditionally.

_u0zy021TKyGokNTy3pqkA.text: Been there many times for happy hour, which is one of the better ones in the downtown area, though they're in the Strip District. Great selection of food on the bar menu which is all discounted for happy hour...a couple generous burgers, fried shark tacos, a Pittsburgh-style steak salad, and much more. Very decent house wines, beer and a few cocktails on happy hour too, and it runs till 7pm which is a bonus. Some great waitstaff including a few alumni from the late, great Six Penn Kitchen such as Kristen in the lounge and manager David.  Though I haven't had a sit-down dinner there in years, I would expect it is the same quality as the service and food in the bar/lounge.

f_ZwwhXPDQEDMin1X8dMoQ.text: Great look and feel. Amazing sea food, bland dry over priced mac 'n ' cheese, and great customer service. I told my waitress I was disappointed in my mac, she asked to replace it and took it off the bill which was great customer service.  Very classy place and nice clientele. I will say their air filtration system isn't as good as blend's , BUT they have a bigger menu, less pompous clientele, better staff, and cheaper prices on the same cigars.

wRbdIi9nyjSQRFNwd9cULA.text: Came in on a Wednesday night for Burger Day.  Any burger on their bar menu (I think there are only 5) with fries for $10.  I had been seeing (and hearing) Mark Madden rave about the Super Genius Burger for a week and knew I had to try it.    We got in a little after 5:00 and had plenty of bar table seating to choose from.  The bar was full and lively so it felt comfortable.  We were greeted immediately by a friendly waiter who offered drinks.  We opted for our beer of choice- Coors Light.  They were delivered immediately with glasses of water for a chaser.  ;)  Our server asked if we were there for Burger Day and he pointed our the bar specials for us to review.  I ordered the Super Genius and my wife ordered the Pizza Burger.  We had seen them each posted on FaceBook looking mouth watering and wondered how ours would look.  The place started to fill up and we ordered our second beers.  I'm guessing the burgers took about 40 minutes to come out, which seemed odd because the actual restaurant was empty and I guess the chef waits for several orders to come in before he starts cooking.    My burger was exactly as pictured but the fries were a tad greasy- probably because the fryer wasn't hot enough.  But the burger made up for it.  It's made of 2- 8oz fresh prime beef patties, house cured bacon, blue cheese, sriracha ketchup, bacon jam, lettuce & tomato on a house made bun.  Way too big to fit in my, (or anyone else's) mouth all at once, but it was fun to imagine.  I started to dismantle it and each bite was delicious.  The Pizza Burger came out very similar to the picture- basically a personal pizza created on the top half of your bun and an 8oz prime beef patty beneath creating a mouth watering masterpiece.  See my pics.  :)  This was our second visit and we have been pleased both times.  They post a Calendar of Events and have live music Thursdays thru Saturdays.    I think our next visit will be on a Tuesday for Dollar Oyster Night.  This place could become a regular haunt for us...

Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The massive Pizza Burger...!
Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hey @MarkMaddenX, I got your flag...

FSpUaCF8rC7ywTh_37DPxA.text: Truthfully, based on the food alone, I'd give it 3 stars; however, the drinks, ambience, and the fact that Boyfriend surprised me after I got back in town made the dining experience a lot more pleasurable.   It's in a pretty good location (as the Strip District is known for their numerous restaurants + close proximity to Downtown Pitt), and street parking was really easy to find. We asked for a booth in our reservation, which we did not get, but the hostess was very apologetic and brought us to a table with minimal background noise level.  We started off with mixed drinks/cocktails, which were tasty (and super strong!)   For appetizer, we chose calamari. Contrary to my previous experiences of receiving subpar calamari at other Pittsburgh restaurants, this dish was light and had a great texture. It was crispy on the outside (definitely fried to order!) and the inside was chewy (but not rubbery).   Unfortunately, I found the entrees and desserts to be on the mediocre end. Both dishes were salty and unimpressive. We usually don't order dessert, but we felt that something sweet was necessary to balance the saltiness of the meal.   This restaurant will be memorable not because of their food, but because of the occasion behind it.

7lIg2ojc9_2kQ3Y7Ig4-2g.text: They make a good cioppino. Solid portions of seafood and complimentary breads are tasty. Service is friendly and personable. Live music with a local cover band was available during my visit here. It was kind of empty when I went, which made the vibe a little so-so. I may be spoiled living in the San Francisco Bay Area with the plethora of high quality cioppinos at my fingertips, but I was satisfied with my dinner nonetheless. With the many other restaurants options in the strip district, I don't think I'll be in a rush to return. Food was fine but nothing memorable.

Eq6OSavoP2hRpKQPC_Qh2g.text: My wife and I celebrated our Anniversary here on a Saturday night.  I made reservations about 3 weeks ahead of time.  We were looking for a nice restaurant that received good Yelp reviews and one that we had never been to before.  This one did both for us so we tried them out.     I saw on their website that they have complimentary valet service after 5 on the weekends so we used that.  I found it on the side of the restaurant and they parked our car while we walked in.  They sat us in a four-seat table in the middle of the floor.  It wasn't bad.   We got a waiter by the name of Todd.  He was an older gentlemen.  A little slow but nice.  He gave us the drink and the food menu to look over.  On the Yelp app when you check in you can get a free appetizer here if you buy two entrees.  I showed that to our waiter and he said he had never seen it before but he would check with his boss to make sure we could use it on any appetizer.  He came back and he said we can choose whatever appetizer that we would like for free.  Boom!!! That was great so we went with the shrimp cocktail.   The shrimp came out and we received our own plates.  There were two large shrimp on each of our plates with Artisan lettuce on the side.  The shrimp with their homemade cocktail sauce was delicious.  They gave so much Artisan lettuce on the plate I joked with my wife that this was a small salad.  She then put some oil from the bread that they gave us on the lettuce and made a small salad.  I did the same thing it was good!  Speaking of the bread we destroyed that too.  We don't usually eat bread but we were hungry and it was good.   My wife ordered a drink that she enjoyed and I just had water.  For our entree I ordered the King Salmon and my wife ordered from their special menu of the day which was bass.   It took a little while for our food to come out but it wasn't too long of a wait.  When it came out it looked great.  My wife really liked her fish that came with polenta and we ordered a side of scallops which here delicious too.  My Salmon was good but It wasn't the best Salmon that I have tasted before.  I say that because I usually prefer it more rare and they didn't ask how I preferred it but it was still really good  4 out of 5 Salmon.     When I made my reservations I told them it was for our anniversary so they gave us complimentary cake for dessert.  I didn't understand what our waiter was saying about the dessert when he brought out their dessert menu too.  I thought he said we could pick either the cake or something off of their menu but he meant we can order something additional off of their dessert menu with our complimentary cake.  So we had ice cream cake and 3 scoops of ice cream off of their dessert menu for dessert.  I love dessert but my wife usually stays away from it but we both crushed the dessert. It was great.  Check out my wife's review to look at the pictures of our dessert.   We waited for dessert and our check for a little while.  When we got out o eat at a decent restaurant we usually are done within an hour but this took us two hours.  We still had a good time but service got slow there at the end.       Overall, it's a really nice restaurant.  I'm glad we came here for our anniversary.  If your looking for something in the Strip and want some good steak or seafood this is a good option for you.

zGoqU0T123lspWg-FpO9Sg.text: This review is based solely on Friday nights at the bar/lounge area of Cioppino. I have never eaten on the dining room side. Having said that, Cioppino has lots of great free live music on Friday nights in their bar/lounge area which is quite swanky. There are bar stools, low & high top tables & a couch seating area. Bands typically play 7-11pm, no cover. They have various happy hour specials such as $2 off beer, $5 house wine & $4 off bar menu food. Their cod sandwich was outstanding and a mere $6 at happy hour (5-7) & came with a boatload of fries. I had a house Pinot Grigio. The clientele varies, but it's more upscale yet casual & draws a 35 & up crowd. I like the ambience & their food is good (but pricey if you're not there during happy hour). I've gotten away with a meal & 2 drinks during happy hour for $20, but after happy hour I've paid as much as $65 with tip for a meal & a few drinks. They have complimentary valet parking. The restaurant is tucked back on Railroad St just off Smallman. Definitely worth checking out for a nice date night or outing with girlfriends.   This is a 8/24/18 update: I have been to Cioppino about 8 times. All Friday nights for live music. The food is always good. It is pricy. This Friday I arrived to see the Midnight Express Blues Band who are all friends of mine. The bar area was empty & so no issue finding a seat. I was seated perhaps 10 minutes as the band finished their first set before they took a break. There was one bartender who the entire night seemed overwhelmed & generally not in a good mood. I like to give people the benefit of the doubt that they are having a bad day & I was told by a band member that she was indeed not having a good day due to car issues & that she was usually more upbeat & friendly. Anyway, I wasn't waited on in 10 minutes or so & then that band finished & sat next to me & got meals & drinks. I noticed a set of menus has been placed in front of me while my back was turned & I was talking, but it was literally 1/2 hour before I was ever asked if I wanted a drink! I was not in a hurry, but did order food as soon as I ordered my drink fearing another long wait. Then she was back & had forgotten what ordered to drink. A male server brought my burger & I had asked when ordering for mayo & mustard on the side, but there were no condiments & the guy walked away before I could ask. So another 10 min go by before I could get the bartender's attention. I got the mayo & mustard but each time it seemed like an irritation to her & I just got a bad vibe. When I ordered a second drink & more water it was again 10 min before I received it. No one ever ask if my burger was prepared ok or if I needed anything else. So, as you can see, I gave Cioppino 5 stars in the past & this is the first not up to par experience I've had there. But if this had been my first visit I'd be inclined not to return based on tonight's service. Hopefully next time I return the bartender will not be having a bad night & not let her bad mood reflect on patrons. I usually tip 20%, but only 15% tonight.

sMQVLFt6TIHnZ2CO8kJnKQ.text: Food: Not Good - My oxtail pasta was flavorless and pasta overcooked. It was so bad I had to send it back. Drinks were pretty normal.  Service: Very Good - Everyone was extremely friendly and professional. The place is in a great location and has a nice open feel and decor.  Overall: Not Recommend - I did not visit the cigar section, only the resturant. However, this place is leaps and bounds from being able to present a tasty and descent plate of food for the price. The space itself is wonderful but not a destination for anything else. Hoping some drastic improvements (salt) in the kitchen happens or they might as well take away the resturant part of their name.

Dy1kOh80fowFNtdd9h5lqQ.text: Based on last night's dinner I am raising Cioppino's rating to 4 stars, although it is rounded up from 3.6 or so. The menu, while limited, featured a couple of items of interest. We tried the fried squash blossoms, which were very good. Our entres were crab cakes and a seafood pasta, both of which were satisfying. Service was excellent. The detractors remain from last visit. It's a little too loud in the dining room when the band is playing in the bar. Then there's the award winning wine list, which is legitimately impressive, but lacks any reasonably priced bottles. The lowest priced California Chardonnay is $55, a little high for an everyday dinner. The price was fair for the bottle, but more than I wanted to spend. We would visit more often if there were some lower priced wine selections.

oXv2y7L1BiO3YRhqwPZeTw.text: My husband and I went to Cioppino Restaurant for our anniversary back in February and we are STILL raving about our experience.   Our server was super friendly and asked if we had any questions about the menu. She was happy to explain things and made great recommendations.  I ordered the Chilean sea bass Oscar and let me tell you... it was some of the best fish I have ever had. The dish was flavorful and melt in your mouth. I could order that every time and be satisfied!   Our dessert was absolutely incredible. We got the sampler of fresh beignets, banana walnut French toast, chocolate covered bacon, chocolate Guinness cake, creme brulee, and house made turtles. My birthday is tomorrow and I'm thinking of going there just for dessert!!   Thank you Cioppino restaurant and cigar bar for a wonderful evening!!

ebbBNO89wLJbl0gL-ekT7w.text: There are some really great things about this place and it would probably have been 5 stars except for my entree.     The good:   - The lounge/bar area is large and comfortable.  We originally had a reservation for the dining room, but elected to stay in the lounge to eat instead.    - They have a good happy hour and live music on some nights.  We thoroughly enjoyed the music and appreciated that it started at 7.   - The service at our bar table was excellent.   Our server was friendly, prompt, and helpful.    - The appetizers we had and the sea bass dish were all really good.  The sea bass definitely could have used something to round out the meal. It was a decent portion of fish and a little asparagus - no starch.  - They will give you a parking ticket to get out of the Cork Factory garage if you ask.       The "eh": - The service at the bar itself always feels a little stuffy to me. I much preferred our waiter at the table.    - The first table we sat at was in the sun.  The blind that would have fixed that was broken/removed, so we ended up relocating.    - The crab cake entree was not great. It had potential, but there were quite a few shells and that completely ruined it for me.   The bacon and brussels mac and cheese was good, but I couldn't pick out a brussels sprout in it at all.  There was a bit of bacon, but it just wasn't what I expected from the menu description.  Our server offered a free dessert or drink because of the shells, which I appreciated.    Overall, I like the place and would go back, but I might order differently.

ag6RG9F8izrlxptn3gLbhg.text: Simply incredible!  If you don't love this place, check your pulse!  It is beautiful!  The cigar bar is relaxing, fun, upscale, comfortable.  They have an excellent selection of liqueurs.  The staff is exceptionally friendly and professional.  The food is delicious and well presented.  It is an exceptional value!  I feel lucky to have chosen this establishment for dinner.  In a way, it feels like home.  There is nothing negative I can say about it.  On the night we dined, they had live music and it too was incredible.  If I lived in Pittsburgh, I would frequent and I may return to Pittsburgh just to revisit.

x-0gI9QFABgEzelyljRGhQ.text: The sea bass was absolutely delicious! I would order that every time. I didn't try much else except the dessert and a salad which were both decent.

T29HGvNQl8o9zpl3uigmfg.text: My friends and I made plans to meet here for happy hour last week to grab a bite, a drink, and catch up. Cioppino is central for all of us so we decided to try. Unfortunately, the experience left much to be desired..  1. The bar area was empty except for 1-2 people sitting at the bar. I said there would be 3 of us and the hostess told me to sit anywhere. For how empty it was, it took an exceptionally long time for a server to finally take our order.  2. I was excited to see that they offered a great happy hour selection. Each of us ordered a glass of red wine. When they arrived at the table, my glass had a more generous pour than the rest, but was obviously the end of the bottle. It had a foul smell and taste. For someone who rarely sends anything back, I couldn't get past it and had to send it back.  3. 2/3 of us ordered the smoked chicken tacos. The description is "house smoked chicken, lettuce, spicy salsa, and pepper jack cheese." When they arrived at the table, the chicken had a black film or skin on it which made it look very unappealing.The "spicy salsa" could not really be classified as a salsa. It was 2-3 chunks of tomatoes with TONS of onions. After taking one bite, the chicken was chewy and the onion extremely overpowering. We waited to talk to the server and she said she would send a manager to the table.  4. When the manager approached the table, he stood with his hands on his hips and did not want to hear anything we had to say. He said the tacos are one of their best sellers and maybe we weren't familiar with "smoked" chicken.   I am giving them 2 stars because they eventually did comp Tacos, but there was nothing professional about our interaction with management. Needless to say, we will not be returning.   4. When the server returned

aIG2H2EFflrdMh7HV154NA.text: This place was the best!  We were immediately seated and were welcomed by our great waiter Ben.  This guy was the best and made the night a pleasure !  Food was delicious! Lobster risotto was everything we read about and goat cheese salad very flavorful.  Filet scallops and crab cakes cooked to perfection!  Gelato to die for!  We had a nice view of the cork factory and residents parading their cute pooches for an evening walk.  We were new to the Pitt area for dinner and will return for sure!

dYj7fdblG8QEStHvhpv2ug.text: My husband and I usually love it here, but our recent experience makes me question our loyalty. We know "holidays' can we a busier time, and we never usually go out on v-day, but because we love this place, we decided to go. They sat us in the bar area for dinner, so it was just pretty loud. They weren't particularly busy, so I am not sure why this was. Our server (didnt even get her name) was not friendly at all. She hardly came by our table, and then another server showed up at the end of our meal to pick up our plates that had been just sitting there for a while. It did seem like they were short staffed because we went to the cigar room and it was packed. The server/bartender in there was the only one, so she was less than pleasant also, but I suppose I might get frustrated trying to serve the needs of 30 plus people in a room and being the only one. Overall, I am not sure we would be back soon. The food was good, my husband had the ribeye and I had the crab cakes. If anything, we would go back for the food, but the usual atmosphere and service just kinda stunk.

guQY6hvXJsZNhe6DeNEjzg.text: My friend Katie introducted me to this place last summer and fell in love with the cigar bar portion.  No frills here, just a comfortable place to enjoy some drinks and a cigar.  I recommend bringing your own cigar, theirs are a bit overpriced.

AjPhndftkivCmIO1xLFREA.text: Went there for dinner on a Thursday evening.  The service was good but the food was overpriced and the quality was lacking.  My friend ordered the scallops and received 2 scallops.  Really, two scallops.  My fish was so overcooked it had the texture of mashed potatoes and the arugula served with it was cold and was so bitter it was inedible. Won't be going there again.

pl-VYEZ81laRm-41bPSWdA.text: What else do I have to say about this place . Easily the best date bar in Pittsburgh and a great restaurant .

arvr-14210WQZ8UhRCdIOQ.text: This is a 3.5 star review, and I feel bad rounding down, but even though it was nice, it just missed the spot in ways that a restaurant at this price point shouldn't. The Friday evening started off on a great note and just went on a very gradual slide down.  The space is very nice, with a warm feel. Sometimes you can smell the waft of cigar smoke from the bar. I was choosing between the tuna tatare and the calamari for my appetizer. The waiter steered me toward the tuna, and it was excellent. It came with some super-crusty slices of bread, and that alone was actually worth writing home about. My boyfriend got one of the appetizer specials, smoked salmon, which was also delicious.  The main courses: cioppino and lobster ravioli. After the appetizers, I had very high hopes for their namesake dish, and unfortunately I was disappointed. It came out with just some sauce, and the broth was poured on at the table. Despite my pulling the crostini out onto my side plate immediate, the bottom section was already soggy, meaning it must have been sitting in the sauce for a little while. The seafood was generally good, nothing special. I wondered about the freshness because some of the fish, while tasty, seemed a bit too fishy. The clams/mussels were a little on the tough side. The crab was the best, but there was hardly any. But what really did it in for me was that the broth was far too salty. One of favorite things is cleaning up a good soup with bread, and I actually left a good amount of broth at the end because I couldn't take it any more. It was very sad. The lobster ravioli had a very subtle lobster flavor, which meant that the flavor was more about the pasta, which was quite doughy. I just had a taste, and didn't want a second.  I wouldn't order either entree again. Then dessert. We were quite full, and I didn't have enough space to try the warm chocolate cake, which is my normal go-to. Instead we shared a fairly large portion of tiramisu, which was good-not-great and a bit rich. We also had an Irish coffee, which was too much whiskey and not enough coffee--more like a coffee Irish. We were too full to finish dessert and not inclined to finish the drink.  And then we waited. And waited. And waited. After an evening of attentive service, our waiter just disappeared. At first it was excusable, and we weren't in a rush and were enjoying the evening together. Then it became annoying. Finally, after almost 20 minutes, I went looking for our waiter with half a mind to "accidentally" bump into the manager (I didn't). We got the check, validated parking saving $2, and went on our way.  I would probably go back, but maybe just for appetizers and to give that warm chocolate cake a shot. Overall dinner was too expensive for the restaurant to not maintain its high note, especially since it's clearly capable of reaching it in the first place.

a1G7PXj-2mfhWbTEzSngEA.text: What more need one say: Patel cigars and Balvenie scotch. 5 stars!

WT5be9g4SVG7y3Bmf1CZqA.text: We ate there on Aug 30th 2013 and it was incredibly slow service even though the place was just 40% full.  It took an hour to get drinks, an 1.5hr to get a salad and 2.5hrs to get food for just a group of 8.  Then the food was only fair to mildly horrible.  Would not recommend.  Really wish we had gone to The Capital Grille. Over rated, over priced, poor service.  The only nice part was the building finish out was attractive.

W7Pc-W9wkMjsvSKLH7zjKA.text: We went here a month ago with my family and boyfriend.  While their food was good but pricey (they had the special of the day swordfish and the scallops) my dish, the signature Cioppino, was horrific.  The brown slimy sauce was poured over my dish for show in front of the whole table.  An entire prawn isn't necessary, for goodness sakes.  My dish clearly had seafood from the weekend (it was Tuesday).  We won't return because the stench of cigar smoke is thick within the restaurant, even though we sat as far away from the cigar bar as is physically possible.  Sorry guys, it's just okay.    Also, I shouldn't have to pay for valet parking when it's literally ten steps from the curb.  I can park it myself since it doesn't require moving three cars.  Sheesh.

d6OB_u-7-Cd0R3TItxG5_A.text: The Small plates menu in the Bar is AWESOME!!! Love the Elysian Fields Lamb Sliders!!!!

iGNnWhgtJUSJBVu3bZ2Lvw.text: Took my Fiance here for a week-late valentines day dinner, and had an exceptional meal.  We started with the tuna tartar, and its the only reason that I gave 5 stars instead of 6.  The tuna itself was good, just a little bland, although it was served with garlic toast points that definitely made it better.  For dinner we shared the scallops and lobster ravioli.  (we ordered one of each and then split the two dishes between us)  The scallops were some of the best I've ever had - and with a mom and aunt who live on cape cod, I'm used to good seafood.  There were little bits of butter poached lobster scattered around the plate which just made you want to get every last little bit.  For dessert I ordered a creme brule, and I have to say it was exceptional.  I'm a bit of a purist here and so I was very happy to see it was just a vanilla bean c.b. - not any of the 'fancy' flavors that try to disguise poor custard.  This was excellent.  The custard alone would have been great, however it was served in a very long, shallow dish providing the perfect ratio of crispy brule sugar to custard.    I highly recommend this restaurant for either a romantic night, or a dinner with friends if you feel like treating yourself to something special.  Our waitress was excellent, and when she heard we were celebrating valentines day she even brought over two complimentary glasses of champagne with dessert.

XIJ1NCQoyN6WR-xJ5tUyzA.text: 4 out of 5 only because  perfect score is basically being hand fed by Michael Symon. Cioppino was aesthetically pleasing, romantic and delicious. Our server was excellent, wine was delicious and the food very very good. We lingered over dinner for some time without being rushed but were still treated with appropriate attentiveness. As for the food, lobster risotto for an appetizer, yummy with generous chunks of lobster. The rice itself perhaps slightly to 'the tooth', but the favors made up for it. Crab cakes outstanding, pasta with mussels and clams outstanding. If I have complaint, the linguine and sauce was uninteresting and did not do a lot to enhance cw the seafood. However, the shellfish was so good we asked our server for an additional portion and he brought another huge bowl. We were too full for dessert but did opt for after drinks. Could've ordered seconds. Can't wait to go back.

Bdo-fuyW7Jd6dMVcTezBag.text: I was here last night and was relatively impressed with the beautiful space.  I didn't get a chance to sit in the dining room, but the bar area itself was pretty nice with plenty of seating and a better than average tequila selection.  They also had plenty of draft beer options . The area itself has high ceilings,nice lighting, beautiful ceiling fans, really dark wood, a couple of plasmas and plenty of leather.  The wine selection is decent and has plenty of options by the glass.  We ordered a few of the "small plates" while we sat at the bar.  However, you have the option to order off of the full menu, small plates menu, and bar menu.  I think it's a bit silly to have three different menus for your options while you sit at the bar.  It seems that if you can order anything off of any menu then their is no need for three different menus.  Anyways, we started with the beef carpaccio, which was a bit above average served with parmigiano-reggiano, olive oil and roasted peppers.  The flavors melded pretty well together and the roasted peppers were nice albeit a bit oversoaked in olive oil.  The tuna tartare was okay.  I guess the tuna was of decent quality, but it was served a bit above room temperature which is a mistake. I think tartare should be served room temperature or a bit below.  I really liked the cured meats selection, which was served with a nice selection of olives and three different meats.  The prosciutto (sp?) was delicious and served room temperature which is correct.  We also had a few slices of a delicious salami and sopressata.  This is a good option for under $7.  In fact overall I found the prices to be quite reasonable.  Finally, we ended with a trio of delicious lamb burgers.  This was my favorite from last night.  It was three perfectly cooked medium flavorful lamb burgers served with perfectly caramalized onions on warm, buttery soft bread with a sheeps milk blue cheese.  I really appreciated this cheese because it was a milder blue cheese and did not overpower the meat.  We stopped in the cigar bar after dinner and I was quite pleased with the space.  We sat on the comfy large leather couches and were served our martinis quickly.  Overall this is a good place and I'm glad to see we have a decent cigar bar in Pittsburgh.  I'll sample the full dinner menu the next time I visit.

mhV-z8FIjypNeasKQt3RlQ.text: went for a glass of wine and ended up having 3 along with some calamari.  now, i've had a decent share of calamari.  this was in my top 2.  it's tender and just delicious.  they serve it with lemon zest.  the dipping sauce was just different with a lemon garlic flavor.  my other top calamari pick is actually at a chain in manchester, ct- john harvards.  it's little rings and spicey.  so, 2 very differently prepared types of calamari both good.  cioppino is also in a great location -the strip.  it's a beautiful restaurant.  bartender was nice too.

cjlB2_wYjs0H-geOEtluJQ.text: 5 stars for a great event venue.  If I was a company, I'd have my Christmas party here, great decor to host a classy event and great food to boot.  I attended an even held the the bar area and it was great for mingling with a the food station just out the way so folks could gather for buffeting and then take advantage of the bar!  How about a high top to set a plate down or perhaps you'd prefer the comfortable couches and so on to relax with a smaller group.  Use this place!

pAA07zlPs6loBjHtrciX5A.text: Hate cigars or any type of smoke? Then do not come here. This place has a cigar bar and the smell carries into the dining room - it is faint but definitely there. However, if you don't mind then continue reading.   Went here about a month ago and could not have been more pleased. The waiter, I think his name was Gary was extremely friendly and very knowledgeable. They start you out with delicious bread and an infused olive oil to dip. I will tell you that we ate enough for four people but I'm not going to be bashful because the meal was absolutely delicious.   To start, my husband had the oysters on the  1/2 shell which he had absolutely no complaints about. I ordered the short rib polenta as an appetizer and it was to die for! For dinner my husband ordered the Elysian Fields Lamb which was done three ways and he liked every bite! I ordered the scallops  with risotto and lobster cream and I would definitely recommend it. There was enough food on this plate for two. I was torn between this and the crab cakes and a couple next to us ordered them and I was slightly jealous.   We should have stopped here but we forged on and ordered the Sampler which came with chocolate Guinness cake, chocolate covered bacon, homemade turtle chocolates, banana French toast and who knows what else.  For $10 this was a steal but I wasn't thrilled. Nothing about the dessert was all that special and it may have been because we got ahead of ourselves. But if you go with a group and want to have something for a table, you could order this.   The only complaint that I had was their choice of seating. We went on a Friday night and were the only ones there when we arrived around 6 pm. By the time we were done, the place was about half full but you would not have known that because all of the tables around us were filled. I would recommend that they space couples out a little more so that people do not feel like they are in each other's conversations. Luckily, the couple on one side didn't have much to say and the men to the other side were seated when we were having dessert.

tshHF5G0GgPIDK60RdY2aw.text: Made a reservation for 8:15 last night at Cioppino.  We arrived at 8:15 and were told that our table wasn't ready yet.  They asked us to wait in the bar so my husband ordered a drink. That was the last contact that was made with us until 9:00 when we told them that we were going to another restaurant.  Then the hostess told us that our table was ready. Really??  Then why hadn't anyone come to find us?  They didn't apologize once for our 45 minute wait. They just acted surprised when we said that we were leaving.  How is the food.  We 'll never know because we won't be back. Our first impression was enough for us to know that this is not our kind of place.

_iz0jGWlaGIuRM6Pe7fYUQ.text: Great neighborhood bar....nice atmosphere and great music Thursday, Friday and Saturday.  Disappointed that they recently changed the menu.  Seems like the menu is geared to keep people in the dining room instead of the bar.  Bring back the great bar food, particularly the steak salad and the crowds will be back.   If you want to be an upscale restaurant, you need to address the cigar smell.  If you want to be a great neighborhood bar......you need to cater to what the neighborhood .

82QWjMEZFjNC-NJQMqgAPg.text: My boyfriend and I went here on our first date and sat in the Cigar Room.  It is definitely a place we both enjoy because the food and drinks are good, the atmosphere is classy and intimate but, also laid back in the Cigar Room.  We always get the oysters and a cigar!

S9FVxA-sizK3bu2H852RdQ.text: Once again outstanding meals. And once again very gluten free friendly.

MhZQM27_yGvYqwHWNDZJcg.text: Great restarant and service.  Went there for Valentine's Day with my wife.  We had great service by our server (Tom) and other waitstaff.  They have a nice beer and wine menu that we enjoyed.  My wife and I had the Cioppino and Scallops with risotto that were both prepared expertly.

bd4_RDqIDMGgjIvj44-PfQ.text: Dinner last night was great! Our first time to Cioppino and we will be back. Very good atmosphere and attention to detail by the wait staff. We had read previous reviews and decided to start our meal with the lobster risotto and a Caesar salad. My wife loves the risotto as did I but I could have used a pinch of salt to make the lobster pop. The Caesar was excellent and was dressed perfectly. My wife had the pork chop with Brussels sprouts and I had the lamb for our entrees and once again we both came away impressed. The pork chop was seasoned and cooked perfectly and was very juicy, the lamb was excellent as well and I would order it again. I enjoyed the presentation but didn't feel the lentils added to the dish, and would have preferred a more traditional starch. Pumpkin cheesecake was good but the star of the dish for me was the cranberry compote, great contrast to the sweet of the cheesecake.   Updates cocktail menu was perfect for the season and my wife highly suggests the jack-o-tini

44CBdoLbpMqw88o68MTX9Q.text: Had a great dinner! We were late for our reservation and the main dining room was closed. We were seated in the bar area, but our server was kind enough to still make the dining room menu available to us. The Cigar Bar was awesome too!

QvoeJPCaEg5mlXLp5Zk0lA.text: Nice restaurant and bar, great seafood (try the lobster risotto), and scotch/cigar bar next door.

CcbgqAR7oJEipxbKuuyNvA.text: This place is amazing!  Went there with my parents a few years ago   Nothing terrible but nothing exciting either    Very average "semi-upscale-out-of-date-menu" Pittsburgh restaurant   Heard they had a new chef so we decided to try it again   Holy shoot has this place changed!   Pittsburgh now has an actual, True, real Steakhouse   Spectacular black Agnes steaks cooked absolutely perfect!  My wife says the mark of a good steakhouse is how they treat the seafood   Everything we tried was easily as good, and usually better, than most seafood focused restaurants in Pittsburgh   Make no mistake...this place is pricey   But what you get for those big bucks is worth every penny!

d5vkAY3k2zVVU6Fc91uu0w.text: I feel that there are better restaurants out there for the price. While it's a very esthetically pleasing atmosphere and upscale, I couldn't help but think while I was eating my salmon entree, that "I've had better for less" - and when those thoughts start springing up in my head, I know I'm not that impressed.   So while I don't have any major complaints about the food, ambiance, service - Cioppino doesn't stand out in my mind when thinking about places to go.   So check it out or don't...I'm fairly indifferent about this place, but I probably won't make it back.

Yhii_Tvaec2xVqpwYfmlog.text: We came with a large group which I think is always difficult for the kitchen, there were 11 of us. As a result, I'm going to say service was slow. This could be due to the kitchen or our server, but I felt there was too long a delay for food, too long a delay for asking if we wanted extra drinks, I think a general lack of concern over our table. This is odd given the restaurant was not full, I'm not sure why this was the case, and it may have been a one off. The food was excellent, but then this is Pittsburgh and I'm going to be honest, there is a lot of competition now between good restaurants. Could you get a better dining experience in Pittsburgh? Yes. Is this restaurant horrible? Not at all, in fact the food was excellent. But it lacked something, not sure how to put my finger on it, but something.

yKj2zE1KVl22si3h-lnmVQ.text: Was there 10/13 for early dinner. Great food. Great service. It was more upscale than I was expecting. Would eat there again, but would not wear jeans.

lfvVSlJaPqdhFpbaBLLEPw.text: Fabulous service and food. Tasty menu.  Not surprising the cioppino is fabulous.  The martini's are wonderful and the Tuesday night dollar oyster special is to not be missed

G7vjRQMeDKQlMxi10x8o-g.text: Excellent tasting high quality seafood, friendly and very knowledgeable staff, free valet, nice atmosphere.  What's not to like.  We'll be back!

vKdf4uOC4244ZwVnEFQYzg.text: My husband and I had a wonderful dinner at Cioppino recently. We both eat a vegan diet and their very talented chef made us items at his discretion that were inventive, flavorful and beautifully displayed. Great job!

Jvn6hshWGanz7wuUXkkzOw.text: Been here several times for dinner and the food and service have always been amazing. Went this evening for happy hour with a few coworkers after raving about the place and our experience was lack luster.  Our server Michelle was anything but friendly and other members of the wait staff seemed clueless.  Another tables food was brought to our table and it took me going to the server to get a final drink and our check.  Don't get me wrong I love this place but the service tonight made me question my loyalty.

higc4UQ5sW5_NGhgdPjUVw.text: Amazing. One of the best restaurants I've ever been to. The shrimp cocktail was phenomenal and the scallops were perfect. Everyone in our party of 8 were very happy with their food. Pricey, but great atmosphere and service.

P4CD1xpzXhOzvwOde6hfzg.text: I actually have never ate inside but i have had the food! we used them as a caterer many times before i recommend them for both! food is excellent and staff is awesome! only cigar bar around this area, crowd is decent, business-casual.. they do have valet!

R6yccB0IvJkDRN1gCV8zug.text: My fav upscale Italian place in Pittsburgh! A great place for a dinner with friends or a romantic night out. The food is all wonderful, great presentation and fantastico. The atmosphere lends itself to highlighting the overall experience.  Tall ceilings, deep dark leather and wood with a feel that the Godfather would walk in any moment.  Nothing but positive remarks and recommendations!

5Be_6WrFPoDH_GXyHeYYaw.text: Great food and awesome drinks. Waited over 45 minutes for checks and they were wrong. Lost seating in the cigar bar. Don't go with a group over 2.5 people.

EOhiy92OLMW1mLKMs_QnrA.text: From outside, I could see people dressed in their Halloween costumes having a good time in the bar area.  It was nice to be entertained as I dined.  The A Pluses: 1.  Pomegranate Martinis  2.  Crab Cakes - Jumbo lump crab meat is key to break a piece off to dip into the tartar sauce. 3.  Mac & Cheese that came with the Crab Cakes - And I am typically not a big fan of Mac & Cheese  Will be coming back to try a different dish on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab Cakes - Jumbo lump crab meat with tartar sauce and Mac &amp; Cheese

hPniw5xiEP_CR8UBGRP2rA.text: Nice cigar bar ... liked the ambience

-Xx926nLvyk0qiwQzoFbfA.text: This place is absolutely phenomenal. I had to New York strip steak and my wife had seafood Ciopinno. They both were phenomenal. The portions were huge which I enjoyed. The service was phenomenal and the wine was delicious. It is a little bit pricey. But I think it's worth every dime you spend.I also have a cigar bar and lounge. Which makes this place very different and unique. I will definitely be back and look forward to another great evening.

3F51LTwauU0xJWR9PjpZ9w.text: One of the best restaurants around. Service is first class, time and time again. The food is to die for, cooked to perfection and not overly complicated. If you haven't checked it out, what are you waiting for?

tzOFxIVYM_q-0GpZr6rRZw.text: The winter creme brulee trio is amazing!  Vanilla bean, ginger snap, and cranberry...it's just delicious!

jbPS4ZzhEjbcl4K1gHAKGQ.text: Beautiful space to smoke a cigar and have a good cocktail and conversation. Don't forget that there is a restaurant here too. I've only eaten there a few times but each time the food was great. I highly suggest this place if you are in Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Cioppino Restaurant & Cigar Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GyNujDz9Tabxz3CMHmQd8w.text: My son is in school at Carnegie Mellon and we went here for a double birthday dinner.  The service was very good...not rushed and the food was very good as well.  They gave us two desserts on the house for our double birthday celebration.  I will likely not be in Pittsburgh again soon but a nice place to come and have a very nice meal.

LbyiyIgsktw9CMKxe1EjRA.text: $1 Oysters!!  Can't beat that!  Great beer menu, great wine menu.  The bartender was a little pretentious but I will definitely be back next time we are in town!  Great atmosphere and a great cigar bar next door!  Overall, I recommend it!

jSTS5cz6Wx_k9vcwoZkxAw.text: Went to Cioppino twice while I was in Pittsburgh and was very pleased both times.    The service was very good and the food was DELICIOUS.    The first time I went I ordered the scallops with risotto and lobster cream which was wonderful.  The lobster cream included chunks of lobster all around the plate!  Yum!  The second time I went I ordered the scallops a la carte and asked for them blackened.  I had a side of sweet pea and mushroom risotto.  The blackened scallops were so flavorful and meaty, they were BY FAR THE BEST SCALLOPS I HAVE EVER HAD!    Such a fan of this place and hope to visit Pittsburgh again just to eat here!

nUTopp-_2u20KNQ8Hb-E8Q.text: We went here tonight and totally enjoyed the cigar bar, went to the restaurant and had a reservation which was handled wonderfully. We were a table of 8, the amount of time just to get drinks was unbelievable. I was drinking beer so I was served in a responsible amount of time. We ordered a bottle of wine and it took almost 30 minutes to bring to the table and pour. Those that ordered mixed drinks took the same amount of time. The food was good but the service is so slow. We had reservations at 7:30 and did not get finished until 10:00pm. This was not due to a stretched out service but to the lack of attention.  With all of the other choices in town I will not go here again, too pricey for bad service. Since we were a party of 8 tip was added in automatically and looked like we were charged twice which totally ruined the evening.

LMRxcm45DTUulz-45tD4fg.text: Went for dinner on a Friday night and, after a fabulous meal, couldn't believe it wasn't more crowded. Complimentary valet parking started it off without a search for parking. The menu was great with multiple options that looked great... hard to choose. We shared toasted octopus appetizer and loved it, so tender (they braise it first). Next up was ciopinno for him and sea scallops with lobster risotto for me. Excellent and not so huge that you feel gluttonous after. Which meant room for dessert -- we went with Megan's sampler.... every item was so good -- mini beignets, chocolate covered bacon, Guinness cake, turtles -- and plenty for sharing. Our waitress was extremely good, knowledgeable and friendly while professional. As was the other staff. Definitely one I want to come back know to time and again.

OCcBJ3Bcgs1LDX8LIfqD1Q.text: The reason for me starting a Yelp account is just to talk this place up.  One of my top two fine dining spots in the 'Burg. Recommended for 2 types of people. 1. Looking for a great meal out w/your date...Be sure to visit the bar before hand then try the lamb, although everything on the menu is excellent.  Nice assortment of beers and whiskey. 2. Guys night out...Add the cigar bar to #1. The food is excellent quality.  The staff is professional and courteous and the prices for the quality are below average.  On a side note, I recently took my brother and the guys here for his bachelor party.  Its was a huge success.  They did everything right to ensure that we had a nice evening.  Which was good because the 4 hours we spent their before the limo arrived to whisk us off for the 2nd half of our night flew by!  My only recommendation is if they could add a couple private booths in the cigar bar...

l8MMjuSKmyQxjnfK4iRRiA.text: Went for Tuesday night's $1 oysters. The sauce was tasteless and the drinks (Particularly the sangria) was AWFUL. The waitress said it was rose with fruit and "delicious"- she couldn't have been further from the truth. It was Sprite/7up with pink coloring and a piece of skin of an apple. The glass was all ice. And it was $8. Don't waste your money or time. There are better and cheaper places literally down the street.

qN4SaTDoB1bu0A4wMx9QNQ.text: I dined here last night on a date. I arrived first so I sat at the bar to the left of where you walk in and ordered a glass of wine. They had a live jazz band which was nice. The room was really dark so unless you were interested in the jazz I'd suggest sitting in the dining room. Once my date arrived we made our way to the dining room. We were greeted quickly and water was immediately brought over. We placed our drink orders while we looked over the menu. Prices are high-this will not be an inexpensive evening out. I ordered the crab cakes with mac and cheese. The crab cakes had a lemony flavor and were served over a "creamy cocktail" sauce. They were tasty but I still prefer Sausalido's crab cakes. The mac and cheese was meh. Something similar to farfalle pasta with a cheese sauce. Butcher and the Rye has superior mac and cheese. My date ordered the scallops with the lobster risotto. He said it was good and it must have been as he cleaned his plate. Now I did not see our bill but I saw the menu prices so I basically know how much it was and if I had to pay for this meal, it would have not been worth it to me. Much better places to eat at in the Strip and Pittsburgh in general that are superior in quality and less expensive. I don't feel the need to return unless to listen to music in the bar area and just have drinks.

vJsdM7mvBg8p6qhYebVtzw.text: This is without a doubt my FAVORITE (at least upscale) restaurant in Pittsburgh. One that I don't get to as much as I would like because it is on the pricey side, but if DH and I have some extra cash and want a nice date night this is the place we go. We've eaten there three times and each time have received excellent food, quick and friendly service, and have left full and satisfied. I've eaten at Ruth's Chris Steakhouse, the Sundial Restaurant in Atlanta, and several other upscale steak places, and Cioppino makes my favorite. Normally we get the large steak and split it and several sides, but their steaks are good enough that I could probably gorge myself and eat a whole one myself! As far as parking goes, I believe they offer free valet parking, but we can usually find a spot on the street close to the restaurant so we normally just park and walk. I could be wrong about the valet, so don't take my word on that one. I've never been informed of a dress code, but it seems like people normally dress in business-type attire -- hubby normally wears slacks and a polo or button down shirt and I wear casual dresses or slacks and a blouse. There is a cigar bar right next door but we have never been so I can't comment on the bar. I will mention that when they are having jazz nights next door the sound does sometimes travel into the restaurant a bit but it isn't excessively loud. The smell of cigars, etc, does NOT travel. The decor is understated but upscale. Dark tables and comfortable chairs, candles on the tables, and low lighting. Definitely romantic. The food. Ahhhhh, the food. I wish I could eat at this place for lunch and dinner at least twice a week. The food is so good!@ A breakdown of what we've tried: Beef Carpaccio -- sooooooo good. We cleared the plate. The beef was sliced and seasoned perfectly and practically melted in our mouths. Tuna Tartara -- this is the only thing I've eaten at Cioppino that I didn't love. Although I don't think it had anything to do with the way it was prepared -- I think I just don't really like tuna tartara. Roasted Root Vegetables -- it looks like these aren't on the current menu. But oh.my.goodness. If you go and they are on the menu -- ORDER THEM! Roasted carrots, parsnips, and turnips so soft and sweet and a little bit salty. The flavors of all three are so different but complement each other perfectly. And that bitter flavor that turnips have? Totally gone when roasted. Parmesan Risotto -- delicious. Some of the best risotto I've had -- I would postulate that they make this the "real" way by toasting the rice first and then laboriously adding broth ladle-by-ladle until the risotto is done. It's always creamy and soft (maybe slightly al-dente) and very flavorful. I've had risotto from a few restaurants that is just chewy and flavorless, but this stuff is AWESOME. Macaroni and Cheese -- this isn't your typical Kraft-style mac and cheese, folks. The noodles are cooked perfectly and it's obvious they use high-quality cheese -- just a bit sharp, and the sauce is just the right consistency. Steak -- we specifically get the 14 oz. strip and split it. The steaks are juicy, seasoned perfectly, and always come the way we order them (which by the way, is medium rare). I've never run into gristle or any other problems with the quality of the cuts they use. Coffee and Donuts -- we went on a limb and tried this. It wasn't *quite* what I expected. When I read beignets, I imagined crisp "elephant ear" style pastry like is served in New Orleans. These are more like donuts holes, are are puffy and soft. Tossed in sugar and served with dipping sauce they were good, but didn't blow me away. Creme Brulee -- when we went it wasn't the one that is currently on the menu, it was plain creme brulee. And it was the best I've ever had. Now, I'm no aficionado (I've had it maybe 5 times in my life) but this is what I imagine creme brulee is SUPPOSED to be. Crisp sugar on top so that when you hit it with your spoon it cracks, and creamy custard-y deliciousness underneath. I would order this dessert every time I went if I could. Overall, I would HIGHLY recommend this restaurant. Maybe for a nice business dinner and DEFINITELY for a date -- take someone you want to impress out for a nice dinner with a great atmosphere, great food, and great service.

gpJSo_zC6x-ToR39nfmbkQ.text: The short version:  Cioppino is well worth a trip off the beaten path in the Strip District.  The longer version:  I have eaten here several times now, both in the bar and in the dinning room.  The Chef here is top notch as demonstrated by his outstanding specials that never cease to inspire.  He really has a way with fish/seafood that i have not seen many other places.  From the sinfully rich sea scallops and lobster risotto to the delicate taste of the swordfish special i've had, its all impressive.   Since it is a seafood and chophouse, the steaks are also a highlight.  The fillet comes with a Gruyere & onion bread pudding sidedish that is just a perfect compliment.   The bar has a smaller menu with a great burger and other munchies.  They have a great selection of draft beers and an entertaining live band thursdays and fridays.  You can also get the full menu in the bar.  the wait staff are great, my wife and i are regulars pretty much and always recognized and greeted warmly.  The Chef himself will often stop by and chat about the meal and say hi, again the personal touch that makes this place well worth the visit.  Advice, make a reservation.  Also the desserts by Meaghen are too good, i have been stalking the guiness cake for a month now, i hope it comes back soon.

H-1i6r6eVCqf9aLIzGCITQ.text: Way to go, Pittsburgh, on some solid food! Upon my aunt booking the reservation, they asked if we would be dining for a special occasion. Unbeknownst to me at the time, it was apparently their anniversary, and she happened to tell the hostess. When we were seated, the menu was personalized to read, "Happy Anniversary X and X!" It was pretty great.  And I really enjoyed not having to find parking in that area as they offer complimentary valet parking. Score!  Now onto the food. Let's start with their in-house water bubbling system (those exist??). For $3.25 or $3.50, you can get unlimited sparkling water that has been bubbled on-site.  Apparently, it's a thing, but it's super cool, and I appreciated it.  Their bread was pretty average, but I found myself going after more pieces of bread than expected only because their dipping oil which is a combination of olive oil and pesto was absolutely phenomenal! Appetizers change with what's available/in season, but our party shared the Short Ribs, Halibut cheek, and antipasta, and we were more than satisfied.  Salads were nicely seasoned and dressed. Someone in my party got the "cioppino" which isn't much of a surprise since one would hope that a restaurant named after a dish would have perfected it, but I opted against that idea.  After a wonderful experience trying cioppino on the piers of San Francisco where it all really began, I opted for something else.  That something else was crab cakes and mac n' cheese. I have never had crab cakes quite as good as these before.  Truly.  Though Pittsburgh isn't really anywhere near the ocean, the crab was undeniably fresh. Places have a bad habit of over-seasoning crab cakes, but not Cioppino in Pittsburgh! It was seasoned just enough to add a little kick but it didn't overpower the natural flavor of the crab meat. And in a strange way, the cakes stayed together while also flaking apart perfectly. That mac n' cheese was pretty incredible, too with a light dusting of breadcrumbs! From what I hear, the halibut (main dish), lamb, lobster risotto, and cioppino eaten by others in my party were pretty great.  So great, that nothing remained on anyone's dishes.  Dessert was okay. It's one of two things that bring Cioppino's rating down from a 5 to a 4 for me. I got the molasses cake, and though it was tasty, it was nothing like what I expected based on its description on the menu. For some odd reason, it tasted very "Guinness"-ey to me. My cousin ordered two flavors of gelato and one ended up having to go back to the kitchen because it tasted as if the milk used had gone bad. We eventually received an apology from the kitchen and were told that the gelato flavor would be taken out of circulation - meaning there was something definitely wrong with it. Mu aunt and uncle shared the "sampler" and though the majority of the desserts on their platter were good, their version of chocolate covered bacon wasn't so scrumptious.  We all agreed after tasting it that it probably would have tasted better if they used milk instead of dark chocolate and if it was a room temperature chocolate as opposed to semi-solid/melted chocolate.   My last gripe about the place is their service. Food comes out SLOWLY. Our reservation was at 6, and by the time we actually left, it was almost 10pm. Four hours for dinner? Really? There were significant gaps between courses and it was a nightmare trying to get a hold of our server throughout the night. I was practically dancing in my seat trying to get his attention.  Don't get me wrong, when we finally had his attention, he was super attentive, but just trying to get it was quite the hassle.   Would I return? Absolutely! Would I suggest this place to others? Of course! There a just a few kinks that they need to work out and that you, dear reader, need to be prepared for. Buon appetito!

coaTUPmdX58ywLhCbcNDxA.text: Excellent food with even better service. Mac and cheese is unreal. Rib eye was cooked to perfection. The halibut was also delicious.
